title: Greek (1877) Tischendorf Novum Testamentum (8th edition)
description:
The 1877 Tischendorf Novum Testamentum (8th edition), also known as the Editio octava critica maior (1869-1872), represents a pinnacle in the field of biblical textual scholarship. Constantine Tischendorf, a renowned biblical scholar, is celebrated for his critical Greek New Testament, which remains highly valued for its exhaustive detail in textual readings and witness to the text.

Tischendorf's discovery and extensive work on the Codex Sinaiticus, one of the oldest and most complete manuscripts of the Greek Bible, are particularly well-known. Throughout his career, he published eight major editions of the Greek New Testament, along with abridged editions, collations, and facsimiles. However, his most significant and enduring work is undoubtedly the Editio octava critica maior.

This edition, which took several years to complete, remains unparalleled as a comprehensive edition of the New Testament text. Tischendorf's meticulous approach and dedication to detail in this edition have made it an essential resource for biblical scholars and theologians, continuing to influence the field of New Testament textual criticism to this day.
